column4: I am able to run a full Debian installation on my comp, but would rather run Ubuntu... every time I try to install or run 8.10 or 9.04 from a normal, alternate, or even server CD, I get an instant kernel panic. Any ideas?
its the new one from Intel, for the i7 processor

I've no experience with that one.. but you might have to turn off acpi in the kernel line on boot... on my chipset I don't have an issue with acpi but I have to use pci=nomsi on the kerenel line.. not sure what that does but it works for me.
